meanings.definition: Bring back to one's mind from memory.
meanings.sent1: I recall the fun we had at the park last summer.
meanings.sent2: Can you recall where you left your keys?
meanings.sent3: Trying to recall where I put my phone is like solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her words brought back memories I had long tried to recall.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies always helps me recall my grandmother's kitchen.

meanings.definition: Officially order the return of a product due to safety concerns.
meanings.sent1: The company had to recall the faulty toys to ensure customer safety.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to recall the contaminated food products.
meanings.sent3: The recall of the defective cars caused chaos in the market.
meanings.sent4: The company's decision to recall the faulty appliances saved many from harm.
meanings.sent5: The recall of the medicine was a precautionary measure to protect consumers.

meanings.sent1: His recall of historical dates is impressive.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's recall of plays on the field is remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The cat's selective recall of commands always amuses us.
meanings.sent4: Her recall of details from the meeting was astonishing.
meanings.sent5: The student's recall of facts during the exam was flawless.
